qas.question: When did the Smallpox epidemic take place?
In what years was there intermittent war fare?
What did the smallpox epidemic reduce the population down to in Chamorro?
What was the name of the person who started the campaign to pacify the area?
In what year did Quipua die?
In what year did Captain Juan de Santiago start to pacify Guam?
In what year did Father San Vitores arrive in Guam?
How did local rebel chief Matapang eventually die?

context: Intermittent warfare lasting from <a1_0>July 23, <b7_0>1670<b7_0/> until July 1695<a1_0/>, plus the typhoons of 1671 and 1693, and in particular the <b5_0>smallpox<b5_0/> epidemic of <a0_0><b4_0><b6_0>1688<b6_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, reduced the Chamorro population from <a2_0>50,000 to 10,000<a2_0/> to less than 5,000.:86 Precipitated by the death of Quipuha, and the <b8_0>murder<b8_0/> of Father San Vitores and Pedro Calungsod by local rebel chief Matapang, tensions led to a number of conflicts. Captain <a3_0>Juan de Santiago<a3_0/> started a campaign to pacify the island, which was continued by the successive commanders of the Spanish forces.:68–74
